column4: When I create a new user, the only folder in this home directory is "Examples". How do I get Ubuntu to regenerate all files?
I'm thinking maybe I added and deleted the users home directory once too many times and now when I re-create the user account it won't make the full home directory structure?
Anyone know why creating a user would not generate all the home directory files/folders?
I used user and groups system panel
what files were you expecting that were not created?
sound, pictures, etc. All those kinds of things.
have you logged in with the user into GNOME?
I didn't log in as him yet. But I never needed to before to get anything created
On another note, is there a simple way to copy the settings of one user to another? Background colors, compiz settings, etc?
sure, just copy all the .* files over
tried ~/.config/?   or just copy everything with danbh_intrepid's suggestion
